alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Marble and Glen Canyons (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 12 at 1:47PM MST until August 12 at 6:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northern and central Arizona, including the following areas. In east central Arizona, Northern Gila County. In north central Arizona, Coconino Plateau, Eastern Mogollon Rim, Grand Canyon Country, Kaibab Plateau, Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County and Marble and Glen Canyons. In northeast Arizona, Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County, Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County and White Mountains. In west central Arizona, Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons, Western Mogollon Rim, Yavapai County Mountains and Yavapai County Valleys and Basins. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Flash flooding will be possible in creeks, normally dry washes, swimming holes and over recently burned areas. Low-water crossings could also experience flash flooding, which would create deadly travel conditions. Consider changing your plans if you were going to hike, boat, or paddleboard to a slot canyon or normally dry wash. If you do still decide to recreate, check in at a nearby visitor center or ranger station. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Ample atmospheric moisture and instability across portions of northern and central Arizona have increased the risk of excessive rainfall, potentially leading to flash flooding. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety. * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of northern and central Arizona, including the following areas. In east central Arizona, Northern Gila County. In north central Arizona, Coconino Plateau, Eastern Mogollon Rim, Grand Canyon Country, Kaibab Plateau, Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County and Marble and Glen Canyons. In northeast Arizona, Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County, Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County and White Mountains. In west central Arizona, Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons, Western Mogollon Rim, Yavapai County Mountains and Yavapai County Valleys and Basins. * WHEN...From Saturday morning through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Flash flooding will be possible in creeks, normally dry washes, swimming holes and over recently burned areas. Low-water crossings could also experience flash flooding, which would create deadly travel conditions. Consider changing your plans if you were going to hike, boat, or paddleboard to a slot canyon or normally dry wash. If you do still decide to recreate, check in at a nearby visitor center or ranger station. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Entrenched atmospheric moisture combined with afternoon instability will maintain conditions conducive for excessive rainfall and flash flooding for areas in northern and central Arizona. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flash Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding or flash flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Marble and Glen Canyons
